meanings.definition: relating to twelfths or to the number 12
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for duodecimal measurements, meaning everything had to be divided into twelfths.
meanings.sent2: She used duodecimal units to measure the length of the room, which made calculations easier.
meanings.sent3: The duodecimal ruler was so precise that it could even measure the length of a tiny ant!
meanings.sent4: His duodecimal approach to organizing his schedule helped him manage his time effectively.
meanings.sent5: The duodecimal system made dividing the cake into equal parts simple and efficient.

meanings.definition: a number system based on twelves
meanings.sent1: In the duodecimal system, numbers are grouped in sets of twelve instead of ten.
meanings.sent2: Learning about duodecimals in math class opened up a whole new world of number systems.
meanings.sent3: The baker decided to use the duodecimal system to count the eggs needed for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a duodecimal calculator, always thinking in sets of twelve.
meanings.sent5: The duodecimal numbering system was fascinating to study and understand.

meanings.definition: a twelfth part, especially of one twelfth
meanings.sent1: She only ate a duodecimal of the pizza, saving the rest for later.
meanings.sent2: The duodecimal of the pie was just enough for a small snack.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly offered to pay his friend a duodecimal of the bill for their meal.
meanings.sent4: The tiny plant grew from a duodecimal of a seed, surprising everyone with its resilience.
meanings.sent5: The duodecimal portion of the puzzle was the most challenging to fit into place.
